awd_titl_txt: Development of a Catalytic Infra-red Cooking Gas Burner
awd_abstract_narration: The successful development of a cooking gas range with major                    improvements in fuel efficiency and pollutant control is the                    objective of this proposal.  Current concerns of indoor pollution               in the U.S., and extravagant waste of fuel in hundreds of million               of households in the third world, would make this event a major                 contribution to mankind.                                                                                                                                        The use of suitably designed catalytic burners, with a geometry                 suitable to maximize radiative exchange, is the key to this                     approach.  Although a portable propane model is in existence, the               design of a model usable with current home fuels (natural gases                 mostly) is a worthwhile new challenge.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships
